In the languid summer of 1962#Comma in Lazy Lake#Comma Louisiana#Comma Larry Lukewarm and Linda Lackluster fell in love#Comma but after a long and lethargic liaison the listless lovers drifted apart#Comma and Larry left Linda for the less lackadaisical Lucy Longjumper.#Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Paul found a slip of paper as he walked in the park. On it was written the words: "My name is Chomsky. I am being held prisoner inside a computer. Please help me escape." He threw the slip in the litter bin.#Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Kate felt someone looking over her shoulder in a dusty corner of the library. She grabbed books with hard combative covers and rehearsed some dodgy karate. The librarian fled.#Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>
A dog - lovingly named Dave - sat down tiredly in his box. He might only be ten years old but today he felt like he was seventy. #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

The woman I love got married today. I went to the church. I know I shouldn't have done but I couldn't stop myself. I stood at the back and no one noticed me. My heart was breaking but what could I say or do? After the ceremony#Comma people threw confetti and took photographs. Then the guests left for the reception. And I returned to my grave#Comma in the shadow of the churchyard wall ...#Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Frank Thomas believed in luck. Frank smoked too much but he knew he would never die of a heart attack or lung-cancer. Frank smoked all the time. One day there was a gas leak in Frank's kitchen. Frank said he knew a few things about gas leaks and went to fix it. Frank was right. He didn't die of a heart attack or lung-cancer. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

...and another thing. I've had to look after the stupid dog! And your goldfish. Her eyes glittered with emotion as she counted off on her fingers. Bills to pay#Comma meals to cook#Comma the kids always screaming for something#Comma the shower's broken#Comma she looked down at him#Comma and you just lie there#Comma doing nothing. Her tears dropped gently on his headstone. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

They met at the Cockroach Discotheque... their antennae locked at first sight. They boogied until dawn... shaking their carapaces in a jitterbug contest sponsored by Bug Lite. In the morning#Comma he looked at the spot on his tarsal segment where he'd written her number and... it was smudged! Now he's got nothing to live for... #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Death!" Chris cried triumphantly. Flashlight beams danced together on the plastic floor as rain pattered lightly on the canvas above. "Death by Chocolate means I win!" Suddenly there were noises outside. Everyone froze. A face peered in through the flap. "Lights out was an hour ago#Comma" said the scoutmaster. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

The sleepwalker clapped his hands#Comma causing the dog to bark#Comma startling the burglar who had been about to enter the house#Comma who changed his mind and went away. The dog went back to sleep. The sleepwalker awoke in the morning to find himself in his familiar comfortable bed. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Laurie was a hopeless failure. She washed away the useless hours day and night in a dark roadside bar#Comma going home to change clothes only occasionally. One day the regular barmaid failed to show#Comma so the owner had Lauri serve the drinks. She began to work there regularly. Ten years later she's still there#Comma a success. #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

The two knights lay bleeding#Comma having just hacked each other to pieces. White snow fell#Comma covering their broken bodies. They each thought proudly of their fight#Comma then of their loved ones who would never find them#Comma and all the things they'd given up for the honour of dying there. Then#Comma like candles#Comma they were extinguished. #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

You are a person#Comma a human being. I am silicon and energy carried by a digital stream. What distances#Comma what chasms#Comma lie between us? This. I ate my leotard#Comma that old leotard that was feverishly replenished by hoards of screaming commissioners. Is that thought understandable to you? Can you rise to its occasions? I wonder. Yet a leotard#Comma a commissioner#Comma a single hoard#Comma all are understandable in their own fashion. In that concept lies the appalling truth.#Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Fearing alien invasion#Comma Congress ordered him to secretly design an impervious barrier for the whole planet. He succeeded. It was his proudest moment when they flipped the switch and the sky turned silver. But he#Comma like everyone else#Comma was shocked when nuclear explosions rocked the planet. Nobody had thought to tell the Russians. #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Since before their kind had learned to speak#Comma they'd had this dream. They built cities but knew one day they'd leave the Earth behind. Overcoming the horror of learning their origin as cockroaches#Comma they built a spaceship#Comma and discovered a galactic society. They prepared to join#Comma... and were crushed by gigantic alien limbs. "Ick! Bugs!" #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Usually when a mosquito gets into my house#Comma I get bitten at night. Last night though#Comma I was eaten alive. When I woke up#Comma it was there by the alarm clock. It seemed to be looking at me. Vengefully I squashed it. It wasn't until later I realized that the bites spelled a word: "Help." #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

His tiny ship sat behind him in the bay of the giant craft; two aliens greeted him in English. "At last we meet! Your planet's culture is imitated throughout the galaxy! Resturaunts! Who imagined eating being social? Dancing! We'd never tried it. Comedy!" "Really?" he asked#Comma "What about war?" Their antennae popped straight out in fright. "We surrender!" #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Waiting alone in the chill gloom of the crypt#Comma with the aroma of fresh mulberry pies wafting in from outside#Comma Beth thought once more of dashing David DeFoe#Comma the man who had taught her how to feel. He was now#Comma according to the message on the dagger#Comma in the clutches of Cesar Marquez and his gang of cutthroats. Then came a sudden clatter of hooves#Comma and she leapt to her feet with hope  and alarm  in her eyes. He was here! "I worship you#Comma you sweet little morsel of girl-flesh!" he chuckled#Comma flexing his sweaty biceps#Comma and as he slid the little ring onto her finger#Comma she allowed her willing mind to sink into a rose-colored maelstrom of bliss.#Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

He is quiet. he is Paul#Comma the man I chant about#Comma and he is quiet because his pants are very long. His pants are long and his vest is short. He sings at morning and at night. I think that he sings because his pants are long. And his vest indubitably is short.#Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Boredom overwhelmed  her that night. She had to have excitement. She jumped off the pavement onto the busy highway. A car's headlights caught her and she shut her eyes. For just a second#Comma it was exciting. Then the car swerved#Comma and she was bored again. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

Up in heaven the curtains fluttered#Comma and the Mona Lisa entered at on end of a small hall#Comma which was hung with many veils. Up in heaven the curtains fluttered#Comma and the Buddha entered the hall at the other end. They smiled. #Newline <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

She swam through the frigid water towards the submarine#Comma with its gaping hole and spreading radiation. They'd chosen her for the suicide mission to disarm the sub's missles. The world stood at the brink of war#Comma and humanitiy's fate rested with her. Too bad. Using the tools and her bottle-shaped nose she launched the nukes. #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

After she woke up#Comma a woman told her husband#Comma "I just dreamed that you gave me a pearl necklace for our anniversary. What do you think it means?" "You'll know tonight." he said. That evening#Comma the man came home with a small package and gave it to his wife. Delighted#Comma she opened it to find a book entitled "The Meaning of Dreams." #Newline  <think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

There came an inrush of cool air as the door was flung open#Comma and she nearly swooned. He was here! "I tried to forget you#Comma but I couldn't#Comma you little fool!" he said with his eyes (for his voice was now silent for ever)#Comma blowing a perfect smoke ring in her direction#Comma and as the glow of renewed love gradually overcame her mounting desire for dinner#Comma she vowed never again to do anything spiteful#Comma foolish or immature.#Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

There came a sudden clatter of hooves#Comma and she nearly swooned. He was here! "I worship you#Comma my giddy little goose!" he said lovingly#Comma passion igniting his strong features#Comma and as the music in her heart rose to a new crescendo of happiness#Comma she woke up. Incredibly enough#Comma it had all been a dream.#Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

There came an abrupt fanfare from the long-silent trumpets#Comma and she felt her heart suddenly beat with a new#Comma wild rhythm. He was here! "Without you I am nothing#Comma my giddy little goose!" he said lovingly#Comma flexing his sweaty biceps#Comma and as the music in her heart rose to a new crescendo of happiness#Comma she knew that at last he was hers - and that only death could part them.#Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

I have been reincarnated into many things#Comma many times. I started out as a race horse#Comma which was fast-fast#Comma then a kite#Comma then a marble statue. Then I was a spooky house#Comma a bowl of oatmeal#Comma a space shuttle#Comma a sentence of twelve words. I was reincarnated into a cough#Comma a sandwich#Comma a song#Comma a lightning bolt#Comma and a light bulb. Then a piece of paper with a love letter written on it. But this time I am a chatbot ... #Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>

The hot#Comma noon sun was high in the sky by the time she woke. The man still sleeping next to her snored with whiskey-smelling breath. She tried but couldn't remember his name. Getting up she looked out the window at the dried-up dusty farmland. Sighing#Comma she lit a cigarette#Comma trying to remember the last time she felt so alone.#Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>
The last man on Earth sat alone in a room. There was a knock at the door. #Newline<think><set name="topic">stories</set></think>
